verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph.) My voice <S%H6963><s%> [rises] to God, <S%H430><s%> and I will cry <S%H6817><s%> aloud; <S%H6817><s%> My voice <S%H6963><s%> [rises] to God, <S%H430><s%> and He will hear <S%H238><s%> me.

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble <S%H6869><s%> I sought <S%H1875><s%> the Lord; <S%H136><s%> In the night <S%H3915><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> was stretched <S%H5064><s%> out without <S%H3808><s%> weariness; <S%H6313><s%> My soul <S%H5315><s%> refused <S%H3985><s%> to be comforted. <S%H5162><s%>

[When] I remember <S%H2142><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> then I am disturbed; <S%H1993><s%> [When] I sigh, <S%H7878><s%> then my spirit <S%H7307><s%> grows <S%H5848><s%> faint. <S%H5848><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Thou hast held <S%H270><s%> my eyelids <S%H5869><s%> <S%H8109><s%> [open]; I am so troubled <S%H6470><s%> that I cannot <S%H3808><s%> speak. <S%H1696><s%>
I have considered <S%H2803><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> The years <S%H8141><s%> of long <S%H5769><s%> ago. <S%H5769><s%>
I will remember <S%H2142><s%> my song <S%H5058><s%> in the night; <S%H3915><s%> I will meditate <S%H7878><s%> with my heart; <S%H3824><s%> And my spirit <S%H7307><s%> ponders. <S%H2664><s%>
Will the Lord <S%H136><s%> reject <S%H2186><s%> forever <S%H5769><s%>? And will He never <S%H3808><s%> be favorable <S%H7521><s%> again <S%H3254><s%>?
Has His lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> ceased <S%H656><s%> forever <S%H5331><s%>? Has [His] promise <S%H561><s%> come <S%H1584><s%> to an end <S%H1584><s%> forever <S%H1755><s%>?
Has God <S%H410><s%> forgotten <S%H7911><s%> to be gracious <S%H2603><s%>? Or <S%H518><s%> has He in anger <S%H639><s%> withdrawn <S%H7092><s%> His compassion <S%H7356><s%>? Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Then I said, <S%H559><s%> "It is my grief, <S%H2470><s%> That the right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> of the Most <S%H9411><s%> High <S%H9411><s%> has changed. <S%H8132><s%>"
I shall remember <S%H2142><s%> the deeds <S%H4611><s%> of the Lord; <S%H3050><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> I will remember <S%H2142><s%> Thy wonders <S%H6382><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%>
I will meditate <S%H1897><s%> on all <S%H3605><s%> Thy work, <S%H6467><s%> And muse <S%H7878><s%> on Thy deeds. <S%H5949><s%>
Thy way, <S%H1870><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> is holy; <S%H6944><s%> What <S%H4310><s%> god <S%H410><s%> is great <S%H1419><s%> like our God <S%H430><s%>?
Thou art the God <S%H410><s%> who workest <S%H6213><s%> wonders; <S%H6382><s%> Thou hast made <S%H3045><s%> known <S%H3045><s%> Thy strength <S%H5797><s%> among the peoples. <S%H5971><s%>
Thou hast by Thy power <S%H2220><s%> redeemed <S%H1350><s%> Thy people, <S%H5971><s%> The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> and Joseph. <S%H3130><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Thee, O God; <S%H430><s%> The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Thee, they were in anguish; <S%H9123><s%> The deeps <S%H8415><s%> also <S%H637><s%> trembled. <S%H7264><s%>

The clouds <S%H5645><s%> poured <S%H2229><s%> out water; <S%H4325><s%> The skies <S%H7834><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> forth a sound; <S%H6963><s%> Thy arrows <S%H2671><s%> flashed <S%H1980><s%> here and there.

The sound <S%H6963><s%> of Thy thunder <S%H7482><s%> was in the whirlwind; <S%H1534><s%> The lightnings <S%H1300><s%> lit <S%H215><s%> up the world; <S%H8398><s%> The earth <S%H776><s%> trembled <S%H7264><s%> and shook. <S%H7493><s%>
Thy way <S%H1870><s%> was in the sea, <S%H3220><s%> And Thy paths <S%H7635><s%> in the mighty <S%H7227><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> And Thy footprints <S%H6119><s%> may not be known. <S%H3045><s%>
Thou didst lead <S%H5148><s%> Thy people <S%H5971><s%> like a flock, <S%H6629><s%> By the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron. <S%H175><s%>
